sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Monday caught a big upgrade from analysts at RBC Capital Markets.
The firm said it boosted its rating on HD from "Sector Perform" to "Outperform" while lifting its price target from $38 to $42.
That new target suggests a 15% upside to the stock's Friday closing price of $36.39.
Home Depot shares, which have risen 3.8% year-to-date, posted modest gains in premarket trading Monday.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.75% dividend yield, based on Friday's closing stock price of $36.39.
The stock has technical support in the $32-$34 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $38-$39 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
